intro: Lepidium africanum var. capense, commonly known as African peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. It has small, pinnately divided leaves and produces small, round seeds that are dispersed by wind. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
